title: Operating Systems 1
question: /past_papers/chapter_5_1/question_1758015063179.png
solution:
The Operating System is essential for:
Providing a user-friendly interface.
Managing memory for data storage and multitasking.
Organizing files for easy access and management.
Handling inputs/outputs for hardware communication.
Managing processes for fair and efficient program
execution.
Without an OS, using a computer would be complex and
inefficient!

title: Operating System  file management
question: /past_papers/chapter_5_1/question_1758016989313.png
solution:
▶ File management is critical for organizing and securing
data.
▶ Key tasks include:
▶ Defining file naming conventions
▶ Performing file operations (create, delete, etc.)
▶ Maintaining directory structures and storage allocation
▶ Specifying logical storage formats (FAT, NTFS)
▶ Ensuring access control and file sharing
▶ Enabling file search and retrieval
▶ These tasks ensure efficient and secure file handling in an
OS.

solution:
a)(i) Describe the file management tasks carried out by an OS.

Allocates space on secondary storage to files and maintains directory structures.
Controls file access, including tasks like opening, closing, deleting, copying, or moving files.

4(a)(ii) Explain the need for back-up software.

Enables data retrieval or restoration when data is lost or corrupted.
Automatically creates duplicate copies of data, ensuring regular backups without user intervention.

title: Operating System3
question: /past_papers/chapter_5_1/question_1759144871326.png
solution:
a) Describe how the Operating System manages the peripheral hardware devices of the computer.

Installs device drivers to enable communication between peripherals and the computer.
Sends and receives data to and from peripherals, such as output to printers or input from keyboards.
Manages buffers to ensure smooth data transfer between devices operating at different speeds.
Handles interrupts or signals from peripherals to prioritize and process device requests.

3(b) Identify two other key management tasks carried out by the Operating System.

Memory management
Process management

3(c) Explain how defragmentation can improve the performance of the computer.

Rearranges file fragments on the hard disk to make them contiguous, reducing free space fragmentation.
Speeds up file access by eliminating the need to search for scattered file fragments.
Reduces disk head movement, improving data retrieval efficiency.
